Line 3: Line 3:
'''DNA Lounge''' is a late-night [[San Francisco]] [[nightclub]] in the [[SoMa]] district, owned by former [[Netscape]] programmer and [[open-source]] software [[Hacker (free and open source software)|hacker]] [[Jamie Zawinski]]. The club features [[DJ]] dancing, live music, [[burlesque]] performances, and occasionally conferences, private parties, and film premieres. It is located at 375 Eleventh Street, near Harrison Street.
'''DNA Lounge''' is a late-night [[San Francisco]] [[nightclub]] in the [[SoMa]] district, owned by former [[Netscape]] programmer and [[open-source]] software [[Hacker (free and open source software)|hacker]] [[Jamie Zawinski]]. The club features [[DJ]] dancing, live music, [[burlesque]] performances, and occasionally conferences, private parties, and film premieres. It is located at 375 Eleventh Street, near Harrison Street.
â
The club maintains a number of unconventional features, including several publicly accessible [[computer]] terminals (running [[Fedora Core|Fedora Core Linux]]) with a [[wireless network]] for [[internet]] access. The club also provides continuous audio and video [[webcasts]] of all events free of charge.
+
The club maintains a number of unconventional features, including several publicly accessible [[computer]] terminals (running [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora Core]]) with a [[wireless network]] for [[internet]] access. The club also provides continuous audio and video [[webcasts]] of all events free of charge.
